description: For Haiti Earthquake Support

Den globala matproduktionen kommer att fortsätta kräva ökade skördar med hög kvalitet samtidigt som miljöpåverkan och energitillförsel måste minska. För att nå dessa mål måste grödor ha ökad resistens mot växtskadegörare och insekter samt kunna anpassas till abiotiska faktorer med bibehållen hög produktkvalitet. Nya utmaningar som den globala uppvärmningen, växtskadegörare i ständig förändring och en föränderlig miljö har ökat behovet av att ta fram nya utsäden som kan bidra till ett hållbart jordbruk. Blast i vete orsakad av Magnaporthe oryzae pathotype Triticum (MoT) har blivit ett allvarligt hinder för veteproduktionen i de varmare delarna av Sydamerika. Sjukdomen har påverkat upp till 3 miljoner hektar och kan orsaka 10 till 100% skördeförlust.I februari 2016 skedde ett utbrott av MoT i Bangladesh – det första utbrottet utanför Sydamerika. Det skedde snabbt och i stor omfattning. 15 000 hektar drabbades mellan februari och mars 2016, och utbrottet beräknas ha påverkat åtminstone 45 000 bönder, de flesta är resurssvaga småbrukare. Detta första utbrott av MoT i det tätbefolkade södra Asien utgör inte bara ett allvarligt hot för Bangladeshs invånare, utan också för hela den regionala livsmedelsförsörjningen i Sydostasien som redan har 300 miljoner undernärda människor och vars invånare konsumerar mer än 100 miljoner ton vete per år.Hastigheten med vilken MoT kom att sprida sig över Bangladesh 2016 var alarmerande, vilket indikerar att sjukdomen snabbt kan komma att sprida sig vidare i södra Asien på grund av globala uppvärmingen. Situationen är allvarlig och en passivitet i hantering av MoT riskerar utebliven livsmedelsförsörjning och inkomst för över en miljard människor. Det är därför angeläget att snabbt karakterisera olika så kallade isolat av MoT för att bestämma deras morfologi, virulens, motstånd mot bekämpningsmedel och eventuella skillnader i arvsanlagen beroende på vilken plats de kommer från.Detta arbete som omfattar så kallad PathoGenomics, markörutveckling, screening av motstånd och odlarförsök kommer att hjälpa forskare och veteförädlare att utveckla nya sorter som är resistenta mot växtskadegöraren och därigenom undvika ett större utbrott och en potentiell katastrof.De resistenta vetesorter som kommer utvecklas i detta projekt kommer att ge odlare säkrare avkastning med minskad risk för skördeskador och även minska användningen av fungicider. Sammantaget kommer detta att bidra till att förbättra livet för fattiga bönder och bidra till mer hållbara jordbruksmetoder. Våra odlarförsök kommer att involvera odlare av båda könen och främja jämställdhet.Medarbetarna i detta projekt har kompetens inom vetepatologi, bioinformatik, molekylärbiologi och växtförädling. Projektets medarbetare är både nationella och internationella aktörer och utgör en stark forskargrupp med ett långsiktigt mål att minska kemisk bekämpning inom jordbruket.
title: Nya verktyg för förädling av vete resistent mot blast

description:
This funding will help strengthen the Makerere Institute of Social Research's (MISR) role as a credible public policy institution in Uganda by enhancing its ability to provide high-quality, influential, and policy-relevant research.

About the Makerere Institute of Social Research
MISR envisions itself as a centre of excellence in multidisciplinary research that aims to improve academic knowledge, inform public policy, and contribute to economic and social development. MISR's mission: to deliver professional research, publishing, training, and outreach activities. Its main research areas include governance and civil society, health, education, information and communication technology, environment and natural resources, migration, displacement and resettlement, urbanization, and economic policies. It receives its funding from the Think Tank Initiative (TTI).

Funding for think tanks 
TTI is a multi-donor program dedicated to strengthening independent policy research institutions, or think tanks, in developing countries. The program aims to enhance their ability to provide sound research that informs and influences policy. 

This second TTI phase (2014?2019) will fund 43 institutions. This will help them consolidate their role as credible development actors in their countries, and in some cases, regionally and internationally. For MISR, this project will help enhance its research quality, organizational performance, and policy engagement. 

Centre of excellence in Uganda
Through this support over the next 4.5 years, MISR is expected to
-produce policy-relevant research work
-convene forums and workshops for scholars
-bridge the gap between academics and policymakers
-champion the understanding of strategic policy issues in Uganda
-contribute to improved public policy and policy management in Uganda
-build and maintain a track record of high-quality research 
-increase demand from policymakers and other stakeholders for data and research from MISR
-strengthen organizational performance through improved systems and processes 
-engage with key stakeholders to make the connections between research, policy advice, and public information
-strengthen the skills of local researchers to conduct public policy research
title: TTI Phase 2 Institutional Support: Makerere Institute of Social Research

description: The Access to Quality Education Program, Fiji is a 7 year program aimed at reducing the barriers for children to accessing education in Fiji.  The program has been prepared to help maintain gains made in education through reducing the negative impacts of the financial crisis on the poorest families and settlements in Fiji.  The program will be made up of three components: Increase access to schools through a range of mechanisms; Improve school facilities &#38; learning environments; and Support to the Ministry of Education (MoE) to improve education quality and analysis. AQEP is also implementing major rebuilding of school infrastructure in up to 40 schools following the devastating impacts of TC Winston in February 2016. The program will work with schools, communities and the MoE to improve access and quality of education in Fiji. The total value of this initiative is $64 million over 7 years, starting 2010-11.
title: Access to Quality Education Program, Fiji

The International Seminar Support Scheme (ISSS) is a small grant scheme that funds developing country participants attendance at international development-oriented seminars/conferences in Australia and overseas. The scheme helps to develop knowledge and technical expertise in developing countries and builds linkages between the government, academic and community sectors in Australia and our partner developing countries. ISSS is a discretionary scheme. Funds are limited and competition for them is strong. Applications need to provide a convincing case for support, with clear objectives and details of how they will be achieved. Successful applications must demonstrate tangible outcomes and practical contributions to the economic development/social advancement of developing countries. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $6.0 million over 3 years, starting 2012-13.
title: International Seminar Support Scheme Phase III

description:
In Ethiopia Children with disabilities (CwDs) are stigmatized and discriminated, it is estimated that 3 % of them have an access to education. This project contributes towards reduction of inequalities through Community Based Rehabilitation (CBR) in Bishof
tu Town of Oromia state. The project can be considered as a scale-up of the previous project giving emphasis on CwDs found in 3 new districts where no intervention has been made. The project works towards improving access to inclusive education through bui
lding the capacities of local schools and initiating alternative access to basic education and vocational training programs. Implementing partner is Handicap National (HN) which is an experienced Ethiopian NGO focusing on people with disabilities working w
ith the method of CBR.The direct beneficiaries are 275 disabled children and young people and 200 parents of CwDs especially mothers.  Also schools teachers government offices officials and community structures are important stakeholders and expected to be
nefit from the project.Immediate objectives are: 1.  The situation special needs and potentials of CwDs are understood respected + fulfilled and fully integrated in their community 2. Children and youths with disability are provided with equal opportunity 
to an accessible education program in Bishoftu Town 3. To enhance the capacities of local government CSOs and community based structures and support policies pertinent to CwD's in the area.The project will employ CBR strategy that supports children with va
rious forms of disabilities to integrate to their community and empower them based on their special need and potential. The main activities of the project are: 1.  securing access to education 2. Rehabilitation services of the CwDs, including medical psych
osocial and life skill suppor 3. awareness raising and capacity building of the community and government officials4. Income generating activities of the parents Education for All approach and income generating activities which are taken part mostly by wome
n promote gender equality. The project emphasizes women due to the fact that the issues of CwDs are highly affecting the lives of mothers in households. Climate sustainability is also taken into account as environmental degradation directly relates to the 
situation and impoverishment of the marginalized. Therefore climate sustainability is supported by child club awareness raising campaigns.
title: Creating Access to education for Children with Disabilities

description: World Health Organization ranks Ecuador as fourth among the highest number of Tuberculosis (TB) cases in the Americas, with a prevalence rate (per 100,000 persons) of 140, an incidence rate of 101 and a mortality rate of 23 per 100, 000 persons.  The program is designed to strengthen the TB Control Program at local level, the inclusion of institutions of the health sector, participation of the population through those affected by TB, and the participation of indigenous and grass roots organizations.  The program is being carried out in ten prioritized provinces in Ecuador with the highest proportion of poor and vulnerable populations, which collectively comprises of 78 percent of the population, 82 percent of TB and TB/HIV cases, as well as 94 percent of cases of Multi-Drug Resistant Tuberculosis (MDR-TB).  The program is based on the Round 9 Global Fund TB program and will be implemented by two Principal Recipients through Dual Track Financing scheme. This PR will implement and focus on strengthening the quality of Directly Observed Treatment Short-course (DOTS) strategy in ten prioritized provinces, and consolidate prevention and TB control activities in vulnerable patients.
title: State and Civil Society Response to Tuberculosis: Strengthening Control of TB in Ecuador with emphasis on vulnerable populations

description:
Cambodia produces enough rice to feed its population, but maternal and child under-nutrition remains high because of a lack of crop diversity and a lack of nutrient-rich food. Over a third of deaths under the age of five are directly related to under-nutrition and poor feeding practices.

This project is studying how an integrated Homestead Food Production system can reduce poverty and food insecurity, particularly among women and children. Homestead Food Production is an environmentally sustainable, year-round production system usually focused on high-nutrient vegetables and fruit, and egg-laying hens. This project, however, replaces eggs with fish, a traditional food that is rich in iron, vitamin A, protein, and essential fatty acids. 

Six hundred (600) households largely headed by women farmers are raising small nutrient-rich fish for their families' consumption in the same ponds as large fish, which can be sold for income. Households are also receiving guidance in accessing markets for their produce and fish.

A randomized control trial is helping to determine the impact of the intervention on household food security, incomes, and nutrition, particularly among women and children. The project also studies opportunities to scale up the model for broader use throughout Cambodia and the region. 

This project is supported by IDRC and Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development Canada through the Canadian International Food Security Research Fund (CIFSRF).
title: Small-scale Aquaculture to Strengthen Food Security in Cambodia  (CIFSRF)

description: The main development objective of the National Hydromet Modernization Project for the Russian Federation is to increase the accuracy of forecasts provided to the Russian people and economy by modernizing key elements of RosHydromet's technical base and strengthening its institutional arrangements.  This restructuring paper an amendment to the project description involving the creation of a new category of expenditure against which loan proceeds may be disbursed, a reallocation of loan proceeds and an extension of the project's closing date from October 31, 2011 (the present project closing date) to August 31, 2012. This is a level two restructuring which is necessary to allow savings of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) loan proceeds to be utilized for preparing the Second National Hydrometeorological (Hydromet) Modernization Project. It also reflects more accurate funding needs by each category of expenditure based on the latest disbursements and commitments. The restructuring does not involve any change to the project development objectives or associated outcome targets. Since this restructuring involves changing the project description and adding a category of expenditure in the disbursement table in addition to the reallocation and extension of the project's closing date, an amendment to the loan agreement will be required.
title: Hydrometerological System Modernization Project

description:
Aircrete Systems B.V. is a Dutch family-owned SME company which designs and integrates complete Autoclaved Aerated Concrete (AAC) production plants (as turn-key projects), capable of producing AAC blocks and reinforced AAC panels.

AAC is an eco-friendly, lightweight building material, made from natural raw materials (sand, cement, lime, gypsum, aluminium powder and water) offering a ‘green’ and light alternative for traditional building materials such as concrete and/or bricks.

Aircrete has been in contact with Dagon International Ltd., the construction division of the Dagon Group, one of the leading homebuilders in Myanmar. Dagon International has shown keen interest to invest in Aircrete’s AAC panel production technology and has requested Aircrete to work out a study, showing that producing AAC panels at an affordable price, using predominantly locally available raw materials, could be technically and commercially feasible.

Based upon initial analysis and discussions with Dagon, the total investment in the AAC panel plant is estimated in a range of EUR 10,000,000 – 12,000,000, in order to design, install and build a AAC panel production facility in Myanmar that can be operational upon delivery (turn-key, excl. lan). Approximately 80% would be equipment exported from the Netherlands, part (less critical components) could be sourced domestically from Asia
title: Feasibility Study for AAC

description: The project objective is to develop a community-based leadership programme for women from the most marginalized and vulnerable groups in the northern Hindi-speaking states of India. The capacity of marginalized women leaders is built in the use of formal and informal human rights mechanisms so that they can become effective human rights practitioners. The trainings in the project focus on human rights, and they provide issue-based explorations on poverty, vulnerability, marginalization and discrimination from a gender perspective. They also provide opportunities for sharing challenges and achievements.
title: Community Based women leadership programme

description: Japan Platform (JPF) has mobilized the "Emergency Response to the Western Japan Floods" in response to the record-breaking torrential rain which began to fall on July 5 and has caused significant and widespread flood damage in Western Japan. We arrived on the ground on July 8 and have been conducting assessments and delivering assistance to better provide relief in accordance with the needs on the ground.
title: Emergency Response to Western Japan Floods

description: The Central African Republic is a large, landlocked country that has one of the lowest Human Development Index rankings in the world (179 out of 182). The main factor holding back development is socio-political instability in connection with the repeated coups and armed conflicts that have affected the country since the 1990s. There is currently a peace process in place, and presidential elections are scheduled for 2010. The process has been slow, however, and despite the progress, there is continued conflict in the north and southeast of the country.   This project aims to save lives and protect livelihoods of vulnerable groups in the Central African Republic, through the provision of food assistance to over 360,000 beneficiaries.
title: Food Aid in the Central African Republic - World Food Programme

description: The objective of the Health, Nutrition, and Population Sector Development Program Project for Bangladesh is to enable the Government of Bangladesh (GOB) to strengthen health systems and improve health services, particularly for the poor. There are two components to the project. The first component is improving health services This component will: (a) improve priority health services to accelerate the achievement of the Health, Nutrition and Population (HNP) related Millennium Development Goal (MDG) targets by scaling up on-going interventions as well as introducing new interventions and (b) strengthen the service delivery system; and the second component is strengthening health systems this component will strengthen health systems. This component will support the GOB's interventions for strengthening health systems.
title: Bangladesh - Health Sector Development Program

description: The Eskom Renewable Energy Project was conceived as part of a research program aimed at studying South Africa's renewable energy resources and identifying appropriate alternative solutions to meet the renewable energy needs of the country. The program was launched because of the growing demand for electricity in South Africa and the need to diversify the energy mix of Eskom. The project is expected to promote knowledge of wind and solar technologies in South Africa and provide an opportunity to identify implementation, implementation and operational management issues related to these technologies. It has two main sub-projects or components: the Sere Wind Power Project and the Upington Solar Concentration Project. The expected results of implementation of the present will be measured using the following indicators: (i) increase in the supply of renewable energy; (ii) direct greenhouse gas emissions avoided; (iii) number of jobs created; and (iv) investments in renewable energy projects through funding from the Clean Technology Fund (CTF).
title: South Africa - Eskom Renewable Energy Project

description:
De Ebola-epidemie heeft een verwoestende impact gehad op Guinee. De hoop op sociaal-economisch herstel die na de eerste democratische presidents- en parlementsverkiezingen (2010 en 2013) stilaan was gerezen en de eerste vooruitgang die op dat vlak was geboekt, werden volledig de kop ingedrukt. Het sociaal-economische stelsel van het land werd totaal ontwricht. Het maatschappelijke weefsel en de sociale samenhang werden door de alomtegenwoordige angst en argwaan danig aangetast. 
De bevolkingsgroep die het meest geleden heeft onder de epidemie, zijn de rechtstreekse slachtoffers van de ziekte maar ook hun nabestaanden en diegenen die de ziekte hebben overleefd of er rechtstreeks, als hulpverlener,  bij betrokken waren.
Niet alleen heeft deze bevolkingsgroep de meeste psychologische en economische schade opgelopen maar nu de epidemie onder controle is, blijven zij het slachtoffer van stigmatisering en uitsluiting.
Het project « Soutien Psychosocial et Socio-économique aux Survivants Ebola et aux Volontaires de la Croix Rouge Guinéenne » richt zich precies op deze doelgroep met een bijzondere aandacht voor het meest kwetsbare segment, de vrouwen en jongeren.
Het project streeft ernaar de resilience van gemeenschappen die door de Ebola-epidemie werden getroffen te versterken door personen die rechtstreeks met de ziekte geconfronteerd werden (via besmetting of als hulpverlener) bij de bestrijding van de epidemie en zijn gevolgen te betrekken. Le projet « Soutien Psychosocial et Socio-économique aux Survivants Ebola et aux Volontaires de la Croix Rouge Guinéenne » vise au renforcement de la résilience des communautés touchées par Ebola en faisant des guéris des partenaires de la riposte et de l’accès des Survivants Ebola et des volontaires de la Croix Rouge Guinéenne (CRG) aux services sociaux de base et à leur réintégration socio-économique en Basse Guinée avec un accent particulier sur les femmes et les jeunes.
title: Soutien psychosocial et socioéconomique aux Survivants Ebola et aux Volontaires de la Croix Rouge Guinéenne

description:
CONCORD Sverige ansöker om bidrag för sin verksamhet 2015-2017 från anslaget för stöd genom svenska organisationer i det civila samhället om 17 325 000 SEK.

CONCORD Sverige är en ideell förening som utgör en nationell plattform för 51 svenska bistånds- och utvecklingsorganisationer, som samverkar för att påverka utvecklingspolitiken för att skapa bättre förutsättningar för människor som lever i fattigdom och diskriminering. Verksamheten gäller påverkansarbete och kapacitetsutveckling relaterade till utvalda policyfrågor bl.a. utvecklingseffektivitet och den globala utvecklingsagendan post-2015. Huvudsakligt fokus är på EU-nivå, men arbetet rör även globala processer och utvecklingspolitik i Sverige.

Övergripande mål för insatsen är att "EU och dess medlemsstater genomför, i dialog med ett kraftfullt globalt civilt samhälle, en samstämmig utvecklingspolitik och ett utvecklingssamarbete som bidrar till ett jämställt och hållbart samhälle där alla människors rättigheter respekteras och förverkligas." Insatsen har fem delmål som relaterar till påverkansarbete och tre delmål som gäller kapacitetsutveckling.

Förväntade resultat specificeras per delmål. Exempel på förväntade resultat:
-CONCORD Sverige har bidragit till dialog om hur EU och dess medlemsstater i ökad utsträckning kan uppfylla åtaganden om utvecklingseffektivitet och finansiering av utveckling, och att CSO:ers internationella nätverkande i syfte att bidra till fattigdomsminskning främjar ytterligare åtaganden inom ramen för de globala processerna för utvecklingseffektivitet och utvecklingsfinansiering.
- CONCORD Sverige har bidragit till en inkluderande process med det globala civila samhället i framtagandet av agendan för hållbar utveckling post-2015, för att åstadkomma åtaganden från EU, dess medlemsstater och FN om jämlikhet, jämställdhet, hållbarhet och mänskliga rättigheter, och att mekanismer etableras för finansiering och uppföljning i dialog med det civila samhället.
- CONCORD Sverige har bidragit till att EU och dess medlemsstater verkar aktivt för ett starkt jämställdhetsperspektiv - i utvecklingspolitiken och den globala agendan - som genomsyrar arbetet i partnerländer. 
- CONCORD Sverige har bidragit till att medlemmarna stärker sin kompetens och sina samarbetspartners förutsättningar att söka och genomföra EU-finansierade insatser.
Sida bedömer att resultatmodellen är logiskt uppställd, även om det övergripande målet för insatsen är långsiktigt och inte realistiskt att uppnå under insatsperioden.

CONCORD Sverige har inte tidigare fått stöd direkt från Sida, men de har fått stöd från Sida vidareförmedlat av Svenska Kyrkan. Sidas bedömning, baserat på tidigare rapportering och en extern utvärdering av verksamheten från 2013, är att organisationen har goda förutsättningar att uppnå resultat, åtminstone på outputnivå. Måluppfyllelsen på effektnivå vad gäller påverkansarbetet är i relativt stor utsträckning beroende av andra aktörers agerande och är därför svår att fastställa.

Sidas bedömning av CONCORD Sveriges ansökan baseras huvudsakligen på följande information:
- CONCORD Sveriges ansökan (Doxnr.030897/14)
- Rapport över granskning av intern styrning och kontroll, av Ernst & Young AB, juni 2014 (Dox.nr 022727/14)
- CONCORD Sveriges åtgärdsplan utifrån ISK-granskning, nov 2014 (Doxnr. 042932/14)
- Kompletterande uppgifter inför beredningen (Doxnr. 042948/14, 041905/14 samt 042960/14)
- Utvärdering av CONCORD Sveriges verksamhet och roller, av Context, feb 2013 (Doxnr. 041240/14)
- Revisionsrapporter av CONCORD Sverige för 2011-2012 samt 2013 (Doxnr. 042938/14) 
- CONCORD Sveriges verksamhetsberättelser för 2012 och 2013 (Doxnr. 042969/14)
- CONCORD Sveriges rapportering till Svenska Kyrkan för 2012 och 2013 (Doxnr. 042936/14)
- Svenska Kyrkans beredning av stöd till CONCORD Sverige för 2013 och 2014 (Doxnr. 014535/14)
title: CONCORD Sverige 2015-2017

description: (USAID Economic Growth, Education and Environment (E3)):  .The Operations and Maintenance of TraiNet/VCS activity will manage the IT aspects of the current USAID Participant Training database used by all missions and implementing partners to report participant training and exchanges while a new system is under design. This system is USAID's bridge for transmitting data to the Department of Homeland Security for monitoring and tracking USAID-funded exchange visitors in the United States for education, and training and exchanges and for assisting those individuals with the J-1 visa application process. This activity will coordinate closely with a second activity that will manage USAID annual reporting to the  Department of State on the training and exchanges of foreign nationals across all development sectors and will train USAID staff and implementing partners on database use...Note that the responsibility for the management and support for the training data reporting and visa compliance function is being transferred to the Bureau for Management (M). The transfer of the function is expected to be completed in FY 2019. E3 will directly fund any agreements until M Bureau receives funding for the function... .
title: TraiNet and Visa Compliance System (TraiNet/VCS) - Operations and Maintenance

description:
The policy process in the Middle East is often misunderstood. Similarly, little is known about how the shifting international context influences policy in the region. As a result, the link between research, knowledge production, and policymaking both within and for the region is weak. 

This project aims to develop a master's level program in public policy and international affairs at the American University of Beirut (AUB) to address the problem. The program will be housed at the Issam Fares Institute for Public Policy and International Affairs. Its overarching objective is to build capacity in public policy and international affairs, while producing knowledge in these fields.

The project leads will undertake two main activities: a series of field visits to public policy institutes in North America, Europe, Asia, and the Middle East, and a round table with key influencers at AUB to provide further feedback and analysis. 

The Master of Arts (MA) program will build on AUB's distinguished reputation as the preeminent liberal arts institution in the region. It will also leverage the experience and credibility of the Issam Fares Institute for Public Policy and International Affairs. The project team will measure success by the successful creation of the MA program at AUB.
title: Developing a Graduate Program in Public Policy and International Affairs at American University of Beirut

description:
Oxfam is proposing a five months intervention in 3 areas of Balkh province to respond to a recent surge in the IDP population in the area as a result of conflict and violence in northern Afghanistan. UN agencies and INGOs are providing only limited support to these groups, making assistance irregular and acutely increasing the need for basic WASH services and health care in the area. A rapid assessment carried out by AHEAD and the Department for Refugees and Repatriations (DoRR) in January 2014 indicatedthe lack of clean drinking water and limited sanitation facilities as the most pressing concern according to the affected population. Oxfam will work with its Mazar i Sharif-based partner, AHEAD, to address gaps in IDPs# immediate, critical needs including poor access to safe and sufficient drinking water, lack of access to basic health care for high risk displaced people, and lack of understanding of the linkages between poor hygiene and the spread of water borne diseases.
The  intervention  will  provide  life-saving  water,  sanitationand  hygiene  related  activities  to 9,883 individuals (4,205  women  and  5,678  men)  in  3  areas  of  Balkh  province.  The  proposed  project activities will result in reduced vulnerability and improved health ofbeneficiaries by providing improved access  to  safe  drinking  water,  increased  access  to  safe  and  appropriate  sanitation  facilities  and increased skills to prevent water-borne diseases. Activities have been designed based on the rapid assessment and will include the construction of 30 boreholes for drinking water which will be maintained by newly established water management committees. Similar committees for hygiene and for sanitation will monitor the progress of health and sanitation education, the reduction in unsafe solid waste disposal
and the provision of nearly 3050 hygiene kits. 180 latrines will be constructed, with direct impact on the number of women and girls who face safety concerns due to open defecation practices borne from overcrowding  and  lack  of  sanitation facilities.
Oxfam  has  chosen this combination  of  construction, education and community led committees based on its experience in Afghanistan with humanitarian projects where community support is key to the sustainability of water points and latrines and where education is key to improved health and hygiene practices across a wide generational group.

Afghan women#s traditional role as primary caregivers places them in a particularly vulnerable position. To reduce their vulnerability, WASH activities will particularly focus on women#s specific WASH needs. Improved access to hygienic tools and understanding will most directly impact the v
title: Country Office 506588 Oxfamnovib Country

description:
RESOLVE aims to enable impoverished and vulnerable communities in #climatic hot spots# to increase their food security and to make them more resilient towards adverse impacts of climate change. RESOLVE is a local initiative driven by civil society organizations and facilitated and supported by ON. The three implementing organizations (GKS, GUK, and SDS) working directly with marginalized communities to pilot climate adaptive models, a think tank (UO) responsible for providing  research, extension, and technical assistanceto the implementing organizations, and ON for facilitating learning, strengthening capacities of partners and linking RESOLVE with regional and international advocacy work. GUK will implement the project in Northern Yamuna riverine char areas under Gaibandha district.

The expected impact of RESOLVE is for the livelihoods strategies of vulnerable rural households in ecologically fragile areas to be strengthened to be adaptive to climate changes and able to sustainably provide households with income as well as adequate and nutritious food. Specifically, RESOLVE aims to address the impacts of climate change on food security and livelihoods of smallholders and landless households in #climatic hot spots#, identified though country level research assessing the extent to which communities will be geographically exposed to specific change and their capacity to adapt to the impacts. The concept of the program was totest climate adaptive models from October 2010 which would be replicated and up-scaled among a greater number of beneficiaries.
title: RESOLVE: Building Resilience

description: El proyecto Enseñar África, desarrollado mediante la colaboración entre a Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (ULPGC), Casa África y el Gobierno de Canarias, y con el apoyo de la Fundación Ramón Areces y de la Fundación Universitaria de Las Palmas. El Proyecto se desarrolló un trabajo de investigación así como la elaboración de un material didáctico que permite, como indica su nombre, Enseñar África a los alumnos de Secundaria. El objetivo prioritario es que con este material los alumnos puedan trabajar el continente desde una perspectiva positiva, a través de un libro con ocho unidades didácticas para que los profesores puedan introducir contenidos africanos en diversas asignaturas del currículo de Secundaria. Bajo la dirección de los profesores de la Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (ULPGC), Ignacio Nadal (Didáctica de la Geografía) y Ezequiel Guerra (Geografía Humana), Enseñar África se ha elaborado por un equipo formado por profesorado de Educación Secundaria de Canarias y de Senegal y profesorado de la Universidad Cheick Anta Diop de Dakar(Dakar, Senegal), la Universidad Abdelmalek Essaadi (Tetuán, Marruecos), la Universidad Eduardo Mondlane (Maputo, Mozambique) y la Universidad de Las Palmas de Gran Canaria (Canarias, España). A través de la colaboración durante toda la elaboración del proyecto con el Gobierno de Canarias, el Archipiélago será la primera comunidad autónoma en disponer en sus centros de Secundaria de este material diseñado para ayudar a poner fin al desconocimiento de las muchas y variadas realidades de un continente aún condicionado en exceso por los estereotipos alrededor de la pobreza y los conflictos que la han marcado. Se trata, pues, de disponer de material que permita presentar un África plural y diversa que, sin ocultar los problemas, haga hincapié en sus muchos avances positivos. El Proyecto consta de un Libro del alumnado: Enseñar África y un Libro del profesorado, este último en formato CD, que se ha distribuido en todos los IES de Canarias. Con la llegada del material didáctico a todos los institutos de Secundaria que lo deseen, el contenido podrá implementarse en diversas asignaturas. Una vez ya en marcha el trabajo en clase, el objetivo será trabajar alguna parte concreta del material para generar material que posteriormente poner en común con otros centros, y que esto pueda acabar configurando una exposición en Casa África. L La Exposición de materiales fruto de las actividades del proyecto en las Aulas canarias durante el curso 2013-2014 estuvo en las salas de CAsa ÁFrica desde mayo a diciembre de 2014. Ya en este curso 2014-2015, se ha realizado en los centros de diveras islas del archipiélago un taller de introducción al profesorado.Desde el Vicerrectorado se comprometió, y tras el éxito del curso anterior, en sufragar los gastos de los Talleres para la aplicación de la Unidad Didáctica Enseñar África en los Institutos de Educación Secundaria (IES) de Canarias durante el curso 2014/2015.
title: PROYECTO: ENSEÑAR ÁFRICA.

description: (Philippines):  The VisayasHealth Project will support the scale-up and institutionalization of Department of Health (DOH)-led high-impact practices to reduce maternal and infant deaths, and meet the demand for family planning services. It will focus in geographic areas with high unmet need for family planning and high teenage pregnancy rates. It will help accelerate the implementation of the Philippines' Executive Order on reducing the unmet need for family planning services, and institutionalize existing technical initiatives. USAID will use FY 2017 funds to bolster local partners' capacity to institutionalize good practices such as intensifying demand and outreach for family planning services, strengthening service delivery networks and family planning in hospitals, enhancing health providers' skills, expanding PhilHealth accreditation, strengthening the reporting system, conducting supportive supervision, and regularly conducting data quality checks.
title: Integrated Maternal, Neonatal, Child Health Nutrition/Family Planning Regional Project in Visayas (VisayasHealth)

description: This project supports the Government of the Philippines in its efforts to improve the productivity and the competiveness of the agribusiness sector. The project helps farmers improve their economic situation by enhancing their business management skills and financial literacy and by providing them with access to better farming practices and to markets for their products. The project helps farmers gain greater access to finance by working with financial institutions to develop financial products and services that meet their needs. It also aims to increase investment in the agribusiness sector by facilitating partnerships between the government and the private sector on agriculture-related infrastructure projects. It also helps government design new/enhanced policies, regulations and procedures that lower the transaction costs of farmers and agriculture enterprises. Finally, the project aims to improve the laws and regulations that govern the sector by eliciting significant input from the private sector on key reform areas affecting agribusiness, through dialogues that bring representatives from the government and the private sector together.
title: Agribusiness Development

description:
Turkana is in many ways the most underdeveloped area in Kenya. The proposed project aims to improve the area?s wellbeing by providing assistance in water supply and sanitation sectors in the neediest villages in northern Turkana County which have been sele
cted by the Turkana community themselves.During the project efforts are made to repair and rehabilitate dysfunctional water wells in the project area. In addition ca. 10 new wells with water pans and 10-20 hygienic latrines will be built and also the commu
nities are educated in the proper ways to operate and manage the mentioned facilitie.The Turkanas haven?t needed to pay fees regarding the use of drinkable water in the past. We have learned during our preparatory mission that most of the wells built in th
e Turkana County have not been properly handed over to the consumers/villages which has led to poor understanding on the ownership and responsibility issues. During the project WaterFinns develops together with the Turkana communities a maintenance and man
agement model which will be implemented in the use of the water points and the improved hygienic environment.The perennial boreholes will contribute to people living in stationary villages near schools increase the attendance in schools and decrease the nu
mber of people affected by using unsafe drinking water. This will provide a steady and healthy environment for the children and youth to grow up in.The Project aims to achieve its purpose through three interlinked results (outputs):1: Lessons learned from 
success and failure of long-term sustainability of rural WASH services reported and benchmarks of best practices promoted.2: Strengthened capacities of selected CBOs village spokesmen and wards in their management and efforts of further improving the WASH 
services.3: Improved WASH facilities in selected communities in order to fulfill their needs and HR requirements on a sustainable basis.A key element of the proposed project is to create opportunities for the future water sector professionals to have an in
teresting and unique possibility to participate in voluntary work which focuses on long-term learning of the sustainable schemes.The proposed project partner (GWAKO) has amble experience to carry out rural water and sanitation projects and they also have e
xperience in working in the northern Turkana County.  The proposed project would last two-and-a-half years (2015-2017) and its proposed budget is 257 200 ?.
title: WASH project in Turkana

description: The development objective of the  Guangdong Compulsory Education Project for China is to improve learning facilities and teaching quality in selected public primary and junior secondary schools in project counties. This project has four component. First component, improve school equipment and facilities will focus on school equipment. It will support the installation of ICT equipment in classrooms. It will also support the development of digital educational content for students. This content will be available on an existing online platform; and  It will focus on school facilities. It will support the construction of classrooms. It will also support the construction of accommodations for teachers, particularly in rural locations. This sub-component will be financed by counterpart funds. Second component, strengthen the training and assessment system for Teachers and principals will support improvements in existing training content for in-service and pre-service training of teachers and principals as well as the development of new training content. The training content that will be revised and developed will be used for online learning. It will also support the development of new content and training delivery models for multi-subject teaching (including both short and long-term courses). It will support improvements in the current training system by designing an enhanced quality assurance mechanism (QAME) for teacher continuous professional development (CPD). Third component, pilot reforms to improve equity and quality of education as the government of Guangdong seeks to modernize the basic education system, a number of initiatives are under consideration. This component will allow the government to pilot initiatives focused on two core issues: equity and quality. The component will support activities that will evaluate these pilots for impact, efficiency, and cost effe
title: China: Guangdong Compulsory Education Project

description: Asociación Fe y Alegría Ecuador (FyA), $50,000 FyA will develop its program Cuéntamelo Todo Ibarra (CTI) targeting 400 at-risk children and adolescents and at least 50 adults in the neighborhood of Alpachaca, Ibarra. Using a mobile school wagon and nearby public spaces, the project team will work with boys and girls between the ages of 5 and 12 and their parents to encourage dialogue, respect and family participation in reading, arts and crafts, team sports, and psycho-social monitoring. The team will also offer young adults between the ages of 13 and 25, music and sports as alternatives to drugs, crime, alcoholism and early pregnancy that permeate their neighborhood. Some parents will be trained to assist with both groups. (EC-429)
title: Program: Cuentamelo Todo Ibarra (CTI)

description: The development objective of the Strengthening Climate Resilience Project for Mali is to improve the provision of and the access to the country's hydro-meteorological, early warning and emergency response services.It has five components. First component, Capacity Building and Institutional Development will support strengthening of institutional capacities and building human resources capacity of the participating departments and services. This component in the Green Climate Fund (GCF) proposal includes (a) Training and capacity building programs; (b) Enhancing operating frameworks; and, (c) Detailed design and system integration of project activities. Activities and components are now clustered according to hydro-meteorological services (sub-component 1.1), civil protection and flood management (sub-component 1.2) and food security monitoring (sub-component 1.3); Second component, Improvement of Hydro-meteorological and Early Warning Infrastructure will finance the modernization of the observation network, relevant data collection software and hardware, as well as effective communication tools. In addition, the project will finance under this component specialized equipment, vehicles and civil works (refurbishment or extension of existing facilities). This component in the GCF proposal includes (a) Expanding and upgrading hydro-meteorological observation networks; (b) Enhancing data collection and transmission, forecasting and decision support systems; and, (c) Strengthening preparedness and emergency response facilities and operations. Activities and components are now clustered according to hydro-meteorological services (subcomponent 2.1), civil protection and flood management (sub-component 2.2) and food security monitoring (subcomponent 2.3); Third component, Enhancement of Service Delivery and Warning to Communities will assist in the delivery of more accurate, t
title: Strengthening Climate Resilience in Mali Project

description: Los Medios is a rural village located five hours East of Medellin. During the 1990's, Los Medios was at the centre of the conflict between the Colombian government and paramilitary groups, which forced many residents to abandon their homes, leaving everything behind. Since 2011, 71 families have returned to Los Medios. This project aims to support these families by providing them with the necessary skills and capital to rebuild their lives and community.
title: A New Beginning for 71 families in Colombia

description: Every year, over 100 million avocados are being underutilized in northern Tanzania, going to waste or being fed to livestock. The avocados’ short shelf-life makes them largely unsuitable for export, even to nearby local markets. Yesse is capturing value from the avocados by processing them into a higher value product with a better shelf-life; avocado oil. In doing so, raising the standard of living and reducing post-harvest losses for smallholder avocado farmers.

description: Lebanon has experienced a massive influx of refugees in recent years - including more than one million arrivals from neighbouring Syria. This huge influx has put further pressure on both Lebanons infrastructure and the fragile economic and security situation of the country. For this project, Zoukak Theatre Company implements War Childs Performing for Peace methodology to raise awareness in the community. By including children in life skills and educational training, they learn to create positive relationships and develop leadership skills. Meanwhile, parents and caregivers are trained in conflict resolution and non-violent communication. The lessons learned are compiled in a handbook that will be presented to the public.
title: 2016/LB012. Peace Puzzle: Community Theatre to Curb Conflict.

description: Der International Housing Solutions Green Housing Fund II (IHS II) leistet durch die Finanzierung der Erstellung von über 25.700 Wohneinheiten für Bezieher von mittleren und niedrigen Einkommen einen Beitrag zu Verbesserung der angespannten Wohnsituation in Südafrika. Mehr als 5.000 der durch den Fonds finanzierten Häuser, Wohnungen und Studentenwohnheime werden die seit 2011 geltenden südafrikanischen Energieeffizienzstandards für den Wohnungsbau in vielen Bereichen übertreffen und so wesentlich zur Verminderung von Co2-Ausstoß und Ressourcenverbrauch und zur Einsparung von Nebenkosten in den Haushalten beitragen. IHS ist der erste low-cost-housing-Finanzierer in Südafrika mit Fokus auf energieeffizienten Wohnungsbau. Zusammen mit der International Finance Corporation (IFC) hat die KfW sich mit einer Treuhandbeteiligung in der Höhe 15 Mio. EUR (im ZAR-Gegenwert) an der "grünen" Tranche des IHS II Fonds beteiligt, die es dem Fonds aufgrund einer niedrigeren Zielrendite ermöglicht, energieeffiziente Häuser zu bauen und gleichzeitig eine auskömmliche Marge für die weiteren Investoren des Fonds zu generieren. IFC investierte 10 Mio. USD (im ZAR Gegenwert) aus Mitteln der Global Environmental Facility (GEF) in die "grüne" und weitere USD 17,8 Mio. aus Eigenmitteln in die reguläre Tranche. Weitere Investoren in die reguläre Tranche des Fonds sind unter anderem die staatliche Housing Bank National Housing Finance Corporation (NHFC), der Pensionsfond des staatlichen Stromversorgers Eskom, der US-Entwicklungsfinanzierer OPIC und verschiedene private Investoren (PPP-Ansatz). Da der Markt für energieeffiziente Niedrigkostenhäuser in Südafrika bislang erst in der Entstehung ist, ist eine kostengünstige Anschubfinanzierung durch die deutsche FZ sinnvoll. Es ist davon auszugehen, dass vor dem Hintergrund der stark ansteigenden Strompreise in Südafrika, dem allgemein steigenden Umweltbewusstsein und den Klimazielen der südafrikanischen Regierung das Beispiel des Green Housing Fund von IHS starke Demonstrationswirkungen haben und Nachahmer finden wird
title: Energieeffizienter Wohnungsbau - Treuhandbeteiligung

description: Towards a pilot to test a collective purchasing model for buying fruits that are grown overseas and are popular with disadvantaged consumers so that cheaper prices can be obtained for community food programmes.

The continuation project promotes children and youth agency and capacity to increment awareness of their rights through the media. During the previous phase of the project the active citizenship participation of children and youth and their organization in
 student councils and neighbourhood brigades has been strengthened. Also children youth parents custodians and teachers have been educated in the thematic fields such as: democracy child and youth rights citizen rights and duties prevention of violence and
 discrimination equality and participation. In the continuation stage the focus will be particularly on strengthening the communication skills and media education of children and youth by learning modules and practical implementation. This way it is possib
le to gain an awareness of a greater audience in topics concerning the whole society. The children and youth have participated in the planning of the project. With the project ?popular reporter? education will be provided for 420 children and youth who wil
l be able to apply the learned skills also in the future. Communication via the media will be carried out through the production and broadcast of a weekly radio show. The programs will cover topics chosen by the children and youth such as: human rights pre
vention of violence equality forms of discrimination different worldviews interculturality etc. Education will be provided for 220 parents custodians leaders and members of neighbourhood associations as well as 120 teachers and headmasters about gender equ
ality human rights and intercultural dialogue. The themes and outputs are closely in line with the development policy key areas and cross-sectional goals of Finland and Bolivia. The principal beneficiaries are the children and youth school staff and parent
s in the areas 3 and 4 of Oruro city. Many children and youth are from poor immigrant indigenous families. They live in challenging conditions and are at a risk of discrimination and marginalization. The activities of the project promote the accomplishment
 of citizen rights and reduce inequality. The right to a non-violent life and inviolability of children and youth is a priority.
title: The Children and Youth as Popular Reporters

description: L'action proposée dans le BeG et le Guéra a pour but de prévenir la malnutrition à travers l'amélioration de l'accès à une alimentation adéquate pendant les périodes de soudure. L'action se focalisera sur l´appui en cash/coupons contre vivres inconditionnel et en rations complémentaires auprès des ménages TP et P avec des FEFA et/ou enfants <5ans qui sont en phase 3 à 5 de risque d´insécurité alimentaire et nutritionelle selon les résultats du Cadre Harmonisé de novembre 2017.Ces actions seront accompagnées par la promotion des bonnes pratiques essentielles et le dépistage actif de la malnutrition suivi d'un référencement dans les centres de santé. En complément, sur d´autres projets d´OXFAM (projet régional HEA), les CRA (Comité Régional d'Action) seront appuyés pour analyse des vulnérabilités en termes de renforcement des capacités mais aussi les données issues des analyses régionales permettront d'alimenter les analyses nationales (HEA, CH, SISA). Enfin, l'action complétera les initiatives locales pour la résilience et le développement des opportunités économiques promues par le projet d´Oxfam - Trust Fund au BeG, Pro-Act au Guéra et HIP passes- dans une logique de coordination très forte avec les acteurs étatiques et non étatiques.
title: Projet d'appui à la sécurité alimentaire et nutritionnelle des populations vulnérables dans la bande sahélienne du Tchad

description: Funding under this investment provides humanitarian assistance in response to the crisis in Syria, both inside Syria and to neighbouring countries. The United Nations estimates 13.5 million people in Syria need humanitarian assistance, including 6.5 million who are internally displaced. An additional 4.8 million Syrians are refugees in the region, primarily in Turkey, Lebanon and Jordan. Inside Syria, funding is being provided to trusted humanitarian partners for medical support, food and emergency supplies. In the region, funding is being provided to the UN Refugee Agency (UNHCR), the UN Children's Fund (UNICEF), World Food Programme (WFP), Australian Non-Government Organisations and other humanitarian organisations. The total value of this investment is $54.0 million over 2 years, starting 2015-16.
title: Syria Crisis - Humanitarian Assistance 2015/16

description:
Comfama, a Colombian non-profit organization has been commissioned by the Colombian government to build about 15,000 floating houses for the very poor in Antioquia, Sucre en Córdoba in Colombia. 

In average these areas overflow every 6 till 8 months per annum. Further in 2011 large areas are completely destroyed by a storm. Because of this Comfama has decided to deviate from traditional building and is looking at other solutions. 

After research Comfarma has concluded that the Netherlands have much knowledge and expertise in the area of living with and on the water.

A delegation of Comfama visited the Netherlands from 28 January till 1 February  2013 in order to acquire more knowledge of Dutch techniques related to floating houses. 



During their visit in the Netherlands the Colombian delegation has learned about different aspects of living on the water. The Dutch ministry of Infrastructure and the Environment has given information regarding Dutch law and regulation in this area. The delegation has visited different floating houses in Lelystad and Amsterdam. Further the delegation has been introduced to 18 Dutch companies, which are active in the field of floating foundations, water treatment plants, light weight houses designed for social housing projects and solar energy.

The result of the incoming mission is that Dutch companies has been asked to make a design which fits the local Colombian standards. Besides the 15,000 floating houses, more houses will be needed in these areas, and also in the neighbouring countries of Colombia which are facing the same flooding problems.
title: Incoming mission Floating Houses Comfama

description: Das FZ-Modul ist Teil des Gemeinsamen EZ-Programms "Nachhaltige Stadtentwicklung: Kommunales Umweltmanagement". Es umfasst ein Abwasser- und ein Abfallprojekt in der Provinzstadt Vinh in Mittelvietnam. Es verbessert die Schmutz-, Regenwasser- und Abfallentsorgung für die städtische Bevölkerung in Vinh durch Investitionen in die Kanalnetze, eine neue Abwasseraufbereitungsanlage und eine geordnete Abfalldeponie. Zielgruppe ist die im Programmgebiet lebende Bevölkerung, besonders in innerstädtischen Vierteln mit schlechter Entsorgung. Die Leistungsfähigkeit des Abwasserbetriebs und der Provinzverwaltung und die Sensibilisierung der Bevölkerung wird durch das TZ-Modul des EZ-Programms verbessert bzw. unterstützt.
title: Abwasser- und Abfallentsorgung in Provinzstädten, Programm Zentrum (Vinh)

description: This project supports four higher education institutions, namely Rabat’s Mohammed V University and Marrakech’s Cadi Ayyad University in Morocco, and Beyrouth’s St. Joseph University and Balamand University in Lebanon. The project intends not only to strengthen the role played by the universities in training workers, but also their role in promoting businesses’ economic growth by supporting micro, small and medium-sized enterprises, particularly those managed by women. The project also intends to ease into training program diversification by increasing the use of digital technologies. Project activities include: (1) strengthening targeted universities’ organizational management; (2) create skills for employment programs that are better suited to the needs of businesses and labour markets; and (3) strengthen collaboration between these universities and private sector companies.  This initiative is managed by the University of Montreal - CHUM, International Health Unit.
title: University Partnership Morocco and Lebanon University of Montreal – CHUM, International Health Unit

Activities under this component include any efforts to enhance the capacities of the USG (in Washington and in the field), humanitarian assistance providers, national host-country authorities, and local communities to engage in disaster reduction and response activities. Activities consist of standardized and coordinated assessments, monitoring, information sharing, data and situational analysis, joint planning; enhancement of coping mechanisms, including the capacity to address adaptation to constantly changing situations on the ground including climate variability and climate change.
title: Capacity Building, Preparedness, and Planning

description: Participación comunitaria en el desarrollo local en el Chad :: El proyecto se desarrollará en la República del Cahk, en concreto en la Comuna de Guelendeng (Subprefectura del mimo nombre), dentro del departamento del Mayo Lémié, al suroeste del país.Contexto General del Proyecto:El presente proyecto surge de la observación de la evolución de la situación política en el Chad en lo relativo al proceso de descentralización a lo largo del país y al rol activo de la ciudadanía dentro de él. En este marco de descentralización promotora del desarrollo local y con el horizonte de las próximas elecciones locales en Chad, previstas para 2016, el principal objetivo que busca el proyecto es el refuerzo de las capacidades organizativas, técnicas y ciudadanas de las comunidades y estructuras rurales del Departamento del Mayo Lémié para alcanzar una buena gobernanza y un desarrollo sostenible a nivel local.Estas estructuras comunitarias en la comuna de Guelendeng, organizadas y funcionales a ciertos niveles, presentan, por el contrario, insuficiencias en términos de intercambio de información o capacidades con otras entidades especializadas en procesos de desarrollo. Por otro lado la posición geográfica de la Comuna de Guelendeng, situada en el cruce de dos principales ejes de carreteras que unen el Sur del país con la Capital, ofrece posibilidades notables para el desarrollo de las actividades económicas. Sin embargo, las estructuras comunitarias realizan acciones de producción y de transformación de productos agrícolas sin una gran dinámica de reflexión y todavía sin una concertación prospectiva suficiente, que se apoye en una participación ciudadana en el proceso de desarrollo local. Las estructuras comunitarias no tienen, a día de hoy, las suficientes herramientas para realizar acciones favorables para la defensa de sus intereses. El proyecto pretende atacar este problema.OBJETIVO GENERAL: Contribuir a la promoción del desarrollo local en el Chad.OBJETIVO ESPECÍFICO: Fortalecer las estructuras comunitarias de la comuna de Guelendeng implicadas para que sean más funcionales, se concierten entre ellas y participen activamente en la gestión del bien común.RESULTADOS Y ACTIVIDADES:Resultado 1: Las estructuras comunitarias participan en la toma de decisiones sobre el desarrollo de la comuna.-1.1. Puesta en marcha de un dispositivo que permite captar y tratar la información en el seno de la estructura comunitaria-1.2. Formaciones sobre recogida y tratamiento de información que implica participación de la ciudadanía en la toma de decisiones.-1.3. Asesorías preparatorias para la participación en la toma de decisiones.-1.4. Organizar talleres de formación en técnicas de incidencia política y lobbying para el conjunto de las estructuras comunitarias.-1.5. Organizar talleres de reflexión sobre la cultura del bien común y la producción y la protección de los intereses sociales.Resultado 2: Las estructuras comunitarias participan en el desarrollo local por medio de sus actividades generadoras de ingresos.-2.1. Realizar un estudio sobre las actividades de producción que son rentables, sostenibles y que pueden contribuir al desarrollo local-2.2. Taller de restitución de resultados del estudio y de sensibilización sobre puesta en marcha de actividades rentables.-2.3. Poner en marcha un programa de apoyo al desarrollo de iniciativas de desarrollo sostenible.Resultado 3: Las experiencias de participación de las estructuras comunitarias son sistematizadas y compartidas.-3.1. Recopilar la documentación sobre las experiencias a compartir.-3.2. Organizar un taller de intercambio sobre las experiencias a sistematizar.-3.3 Producir y difundir el documento de sistematización.SOCIO LOCALEl Institut Africain pour le Développement Economique et Social INADES Chad (http:// tchad. INADESfo.net) pertenece desde su creación en 1978 a la red panafricana de INADES-formación Internacional, con presencia en 10 países africanos (Burkina Faso, Costa de Marfil, Togo, Burundi, Camerún, República Democrática del Congo, Rwanda, Chad, Kenya y Tanzania), cuyo secretariado general se encuentra en Abidjan, Costa de Marfil. En 1997 adopta el estatus de asociación nacional chadiana sin ánimo de lucro y colabora estrechamente con ALOBAN desde 2010 en cuatro ámbitos: promoción de la agricultura sostenible, apoyo a la descentralización y al desarrollo local, gestión sostenible y equitativa de recursos naturales y fortalecimiento de la sociedad civil.
title: Participación comunitaria en el desarrollo local en el Chad

This initiative provides funding to the Australian Partnerships with African Communities (APAC) program. This initiative consolidates seven separate APAC programs into one initiative. The objective of the APAC program is to increase the quality of community based programs in order to achieve sustainable improvements in health, food security and water and sanitation in target communities of seven African countries. The APAC programs various activities are implemented by six Australian Non-Government Organisations (ANGOs): Australian Foundation for the Peoples of Asia and the Pacific (AFAP); Child Fund; Care Australia; Plan/Burnet; OXFAM Australia; and the Adventist Development and Relief Agency (ADRA). These organisations have already achieved results: There has been a significant reduction of stigma to HIV in target communities; improved food security, socio-economic well being and access to basic services; and strengthened capacities of government and/or civil society to deliver quality local government. The consolidations and extension of the APAC program allows ANGOs to continue to achieve results in all APAC activities. The total value of this multi-country initiative is $10.2 million over 3 years, starting 2008-09.
title: APAC: extension &#38; consolidation 2008-9 to 2010-11

description:
"The objective of the Blanket Supplementary Feeding Program (BSFP) is to prevent a further deterioration in the health and nutritional status of children less than three years, pregnant and lactating women (< 6 months) in the six arid districts of Turkana, Mandera, Wajir, Marsabit, Samburu and Isiolo. 

Helen Keller International (HKI) is responsible for the development and implementation of a communication strategy to ensure that key messages are made available through all key contact points of the program.  HKI will:                                                                                                                              - lead the development of standardised community mobilisation materials and train nutrition specialised agency trainers on the same. This training will also include appropriate community mobilisation strategies. 
- lead the design and development of BSFP awareness posters, and be responsible for their production and distribution to partners implementing the BSFP
- Use national protocol and materials to lead the adaptation and design of the following information cards:  food preparation demonstrations, appropriate child feeding, medication and supplementation, and care of a sick child. These cards will be used as guidance by BSFP staff during routine programme activities.
- develop a  training manual for nutrition specialised agency trainers with detailed information on the above three components
- provide supportive supervision in the form of Routine Data Quality Assurance to monitor the quality by which the communication strategy is implemented. This supervision will be carried out three times during the BSFP implementation, and will include participation of HKI staff, District Health Management Teams, WFP, UNICEF and specialised agency staff."
title: Blanket Supplementary Feeding Program Communication Strategy

description: The grant was to a public charity to support its general charitable purposes.

Water has become a key driver in the Middle East and North Africa's overall development as a region. While access to water is improving in most countries, several still struggle with scarce water supplies and depleted water quality that has reached alarming levels. In some countries, the cost of water resources has climbed to 12% of the GDP. 

Research on water management is progressing. Water policy reforms are taking place but at a far slower pace than needed. The gap between water research and policy, along with divisions between policymakers on the issue, are key factors hindering a response to the growing divide between water resources, allocation, and usage in the Arab region. 

This project will fund the second Arab forum on water management as a knowledge-sharing event to bring together regional experts, researchers, and policymakers to share best practices, learning, and innovation related to water scarcity. Held in Cairo, the forum will examine solutions for living with water scarcity. It will also serve as a platform to share knowledge through case studies and practical solutions that have been tested and validated in the region. It will establish what works and what policies are needed for development practitioners. 

Conference outputs include a policy document with key messages emerging from the forum, which will be shared across the region and presented at the sixth World Water Forum in Marseille, France, in 2012.
title: Living with Water Scarcity in the Arab World

UNDPs country programme goal stated in the programme documentation is "to promote poverty reduction and sustainable development that are rights-based, gender sensitive, inclusive and equitable by streghtening institutional capacity of national and local governments and non-state actors." This goal is to be achieved through three pillars and eight outputs. The three pillars are Local Governance and Local Development, Environment and Disaster Risk Reduction, and Democratic Governance. The two pillars that are relevant for Swedish support are Pillar 1 and Pillar 3.The goal of Pillar 1 is: community driven development institutions that support local governance in service delivery and inclusive growth, including agricultrual development and enhancement of employment. opportunities for women and men.The goal of Pillar 3 is: Promotion of democratic governance and the rule fo law to strengthen democratic institutions and the advancement of human rights.
title: UNDP Myanmar Country Programme 2016-17

description: The Maine Nutrition Incentive Project provides incentives to low-income customers in the form of bonus vouchers that can be used to purchase healthy, local fruits and vegetables at targeted retail sites. The desired outcome of this project is to both support increased consumption of locally-grown produce by low-income individuals in Maine, addressing a need to provide both adequate quantities and quality of food to this population, while simultaneously boosting retail sales of local farm products to bolster the economic development of Maine's farm economy.
title: Maine Nutrition Incentives Program

description:
ACTSA produced the first issue of the quarterly Angola Monitor in April 2009. It succeeded the monthly Angola Peace Monitor. The Angola Monitor has been translated into Portuguese thanks to the support of Christian Aid since July 2009, which contributes toward the costs of researching, writing, editing, producing the Angola Monitor, translating it into Portuguese and distributing it in English and Portuguese.

The Angola Monitor covers the politics, economics, development, democracy and human rights of Angola. It is published quarterly by partner Action for Southern Africa (ACTSA) in English and Portuguese, by a team based in London and with a lot of experience on Southern Africa. It is available online (http://www.actsa.org/page-1499-Angola_Monitor.html) and by email, through a newsletter sent directly to the subscriber when a new issue is published. ACTSA also has a Facebook page where the links to ACTSA's new publications and articles are available. Readers can also submit articles, suggestions, comments, etc to the email campaigns@actsa.org.
title: Angola Monitor 2017-2021
